acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute
acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 1 from 72 hours ErC50=0.1mg/L of the algae (Selenastrum) (MOE Eco-Toxicity Tests of Chemicals, 1996).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Based on the rabbit LD50 (oral route) value of > 8,000mg/kg representing the lower of the two testing data, > 8,000mg/kg (IUCLID (2000)) and > 16,000mg/kg (RTECS (2006)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists
acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: Based on the rat LC50 (inhalation of dust/mist) value of 1.48mg/L (IUCLID (2000)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is "solid" according to the GHS definition and inhalation of its gas is not expected.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 (oral route) value of 375mg/kg (RTECS (2006)).

carcinogenicity.rationale: Classification not possible based on expert judgment in the absence of existing classification, though PATTY (4th, 1999) presents toxicity data.

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Very toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Although acute toxicity is Category 1 and bio-accumulation is low (BCF=46(Existing Chemical Safety Inspections Data, )), since there was no rapidly degrading (the decomposition by BOD: 6%(Existing Chemical Safety Inspections Data)), it was classified into Category 1.

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Test methods applicable to solid substances are not available

explosives.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive properties

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases
flammable_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

flammable_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

flammable_solids.rationale: Classified as flammable according to HSDB (2006). Classified into Division 6.1 (UN#2261 (o-, m-, p-)) (UN Recommendation on the Transport of Dangerous Goods).

gases_under_pressure.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Based on the absence of data on in vivo mutagenicity/genotoxicity tests and no positive data on in vitro mutagenicity tests (several indices), described in NTP DB (Access on May 2006), and Report by the Ministry of Health, Labour and Welfare (1997).

oxidizing_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Organic compounds containing oxygen (but not fluorine and chlorine), with the oxygen bound to carbon and hydrogen (but not to other elements)

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: Although classified as flammable, the substance does not catch fire easily (HSDB, 2006). Classified into Division 6.1 (UN#2512 (o-, m-, p-)) (UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods).

reproductive_toxicity.hazard_statement: Suspected of damaging fertility or the unborn child
reproductive_toxicity.rationale: Based on the evidence of a significant increase in the incidence of exencephalia and malformation of the limbs, tail and eye in the pups observed in teratogenicity studies with Syrian hamsters using intraperitoneal injection, described in PATTY (4th, 1999) (though no data are available regarding parental toxicity). Also based on the evidence of maternal toxicity and teratogenicity observed in rat teratogenicity studies using the oral route of exposure, described in Teratology (1986).

respiratory_sensitizer.hazard_statement: May cause allergy or asthma symptoms or breathing difficulties if inhaled
respiratory_sensitizer.rationale: Based on the description in HSDB (2003) of the human health effects: "The substance induces contact dermatitis and bronchial asthma."

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive or self-reactive properties

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Based on the description in the report on rabbit eye irritation tests (RTECS (2006) and IUCLID (2000)): "Mild," "slightly irritating." The substance is thus considered a mild eye irritant.

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Based on the description in the report on rabbit skin irritation tests (RTECS (2006) and IUCLID (2000)): "Mild," "slightly irritating." The substance is thus considered a mild skin irritant.

skin_sensitizer.hazard_statement: May cause an allergic skin reaction
skin_sensitizer.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is classified as a "Skin Sensitizing Substance" by the Japanese Society for Contact Dermatitis.

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Containing no metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At)

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: Cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (kidney, blood system)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Based on the human evidence: "p-Aminophenol produces nephrotoxicity; induces methemoglobinemia" (PATTY (4th, 1999)). Also based on the evidence from animal studies including "dark brown urine was observed; urinalysis revealed an increase in epithelial cells; a band of white colored tissue was present at the corticomedullary junction; basophilic renal tubules were found" (Report by the Ministry of Health, Labour and Welfare (1997)), "dose-dependent nephrosis was noted in both sexes at weeks 13 and 27, and in males that had been kept away from the test material at week 7 during the recovery period" (PATTY (4th, 1999)).

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Based on the human evidence: "p-Aminophenol induces methemoglobinemia" (PATTY (4th, 1999)).
